name: Ani Calinescu
content: Anisoara Calinescu | Department of Computer Science Skip to main content University of Oxford Department of Computer Science HomeAbout UsPeopleFacultyAnisoara CalinescuAnisoara Calinescu Professor Ani Calinescu Associate Professor of Computer ScienceOfficial Fellow (AI & Machine Learning), Reuben CollegeE: ani.calinescu@cs.ox.ac.ukT: +44 (0)1865 283527Themes:Artificial Intelligence and Machine LearningSee Also:My list of publications on Google ScholarInterests Complex Networked Systems and Complexity Metrics Agent-based modelling, Control and Prediction of complex systems such as Financial Markets and Supply Chains Digital Twins The Cost and Value of Information BiographyI joined the Oxford University Computing Laboratory (now Department of Computer Science) in September 2002. From April 1996 until August 2002 I was a Research Assistant in the Oxford Manufacturing Research Group based in the Engineering Science Department of Oxford University. I am also an Official Fellow (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning), Reuben College, and a Senior Research Fellow, Institute for New Economic Thinking, University of Oxford. Since October 2021, I have been a Turing Fellow at the Alan Turing Institute, London.ActivitiesAgent-based financial modellingSoftware Engineering Current Students Tatiana BotskinaSascha Frey Past Students James PaulinMaarten SchollAngira SharmaSamuel Wiese Past Researcher Hao ZhouAbout UsPeopleFacultyResearchStudentsProfessional ServicesVisiting ProfessorsEmeritus FacultyAssociate MembersVacanciesWomen in the departmentEquality, diversity and inclusionSupport UsOur HistoryContact Us Back to Top
